info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 12 at 2:45PM CDT by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTHWESTERN REEVES AND NORTHEASTERN JEFF DAVIS COUNTIES THROUGH 330 PM CDT... At 245 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Balmorhea State Park, or 24 miles south of Toyah. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Balmorhea, Balmorhea Lake, Saragosa, Balmorhea State Park, Toyahvale, and Star Mountain. This includes Interstate 10 between mile markers 197 and 213. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
